items.name: Prof. Alexandra Smith
items.quote_html:
This project demonstrates exceptional depth in combining graph learning with human-centric AI. The emphasis on responsible intelligence and interpretable models is particularly inspiring[1], setting a new benchmark for social computing research.
This project demonstrates exceptional depth in combining graph learning with human-centric AI. The emphasis on responsible intelligence and interpretable models is particularly inspiring[1], setting a new benchmark for social computing research.
(quoted in their TKDE paper "Does Graph Prompt Work? A Data Operation Perspective with Theoretical Analysis. ICML 2025")

items.name: Dr. Michael Tan
items.quote_html: An elegant approach to non-linear data intelligence that connects theory and practice seamlessly.

items.name: Prof. Li Wei
items.quote_html: A solid contribution in responsible AI evaluation, offering both algorithmic and ethical insights.

items.name: Dr. Emma Johnson
items.quote_html: Impressive interdisciplinary work bridging cognitive modeling and large-scale data reasoning.

items.name: Prof. Carlos Mendes
items.quote_html: The study offers an inspiring perspective on collective intelligence and emergent behavior.

items.name: Dr. Julia Chen
items.quote_html: Innovative methodology that broadens our understanding of multimodal reasoning.
